name: Validator Key Management Tools
program-description: Compilation of tools to manage keys in the target directory defined in the .env file.

description.short: Manages CRUD operations for validator keystores on Google Cloud Secret Manager.
description.long:
The secret-manager command helps you create, delete, get, and alter Google Cloud Secret Manager secrets. See available subcommands for more info.It scans the <KEY_DIRECTORY_PATH> variable defined in the .env file and creates secrets in the Google Cloud <PROJECT_ID> also defined in the .env file.
You must create Google Cloud Application Default Credentials (ADC) to execute this command.
See more instructions on the README.md or https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/provide-credentials-adc.

description.short: Creates Google Cloud Secret Manager secrets in two differnt modes.
description.long:
The create subcommand helps you create Google Cloud Secret Manager secrets. It scans the <KEY_DIRECTORY_PATH> variable defined in the .env file and creates secrets in the Google Cloud <PROJECT_ID> also defined in the .env file.
You must create Google Cloud Application Default Credentials (ADC) to execute this command.
See more instructions on the README.md or https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/provide-credentials-adc.

values.single:
Every keystore in the target directory will generate one secret entry on Google Cloud Secret Manager.
	Make sure the keystores are in the format <keystore-m_12381_3600_i_0_0-timestamp.json>, where 'i' is the key index.
	Secrets created will be named keystore-m_12381_3600_i_0_0-timestamp.
values.fat:
Creates 'fat' secrets containing multiple keystore data per secret.
	It makes the secrets as close to the Google Cloud Secret Manager limit of 64kb per secret.
	Make sure the keystores are in the format <keystore-m_12381_3600_i_0_0-timestamp.json>, where 'i' is the key index.
	Secrets created will be named key-index_l_to_h, where 'l' is the lowest and 'h' the highest key index in that secret.

--secret-mode.description: Defines the mode secrets get created.

--skip.description:
When this flag is passed, the tool will not overwrite existing keystore version with a new one.
Set this flag if you want run the tool in multiple waves against the same key directory, and want to keep a uniform version across all the Secrets.

--optimistic.description:
When this flag is passed, it makes the tool not check the validator keystore cheksum with the checksum of the created secret.
Set this flag if you choose not to give your service account secret access permissions (`secretmanager.versions.access`).

description.short: Gets Google Cloud Secret Manager secrets
description.long: The 'get' subcommand reads the latest version of one or many Google Cloud Secret Manager secrets in <PROJECT_ID>. It generates keystores files with the format <keystore-m_12381_3600_i_0_0-timestamp.json>, where 'i' is the key index, and stores them in an direcotry named 'imported_validator_keys' inside the 'OUTPUT_DIRECTORY' defined in the .env file.

--secret.description: The name of the keystore file to get.

--from-file.description:
Path to a .txt file containing the name of all secret names to fetch.
Great to use with output files generated by this tool.

--index-range.description:
Key index range to fetch.
Value must be in format '<low-index>_<high-index>. For example '--index-range=0-99'.
Works only for secrets with format key-index_l_to_h, where 'l' is the lowest and 'h' the highest key index in that secret.
Make sure that there is no secret key range overlap on Google Cloud Secret Manager or this will cause key conflicts.

description.short: Manages installation, config creation, and other actions for web3signer.
description.long: The web3signer command enables you to automate the installation, configuration, and startup of web3signer and related dependencies such as the slashing-protection database.
Install web3signer and docker using built-in bash scripts. It pulls web3signer with the latest binary.

values.ubuntu: Installs docker for an ubuntu distribution.
values.debian: Installs docker for a debian distribution.

--linux-distro.description: When this flag is present, the tool will install docker for the specified distribution.

description.short: Configures web3signer to run with the local keystores passed in the path specified.
description.long: Creates a configuration file to run web3signer with local keystores. Requires the flag --kesytore-path=<value>, with a valid path to a directory containing all the keystores to load onto web3signer.

--keystore-path.description: A path to the directory containing the keys to load onto web3signer.

description.short: Starts up the slashing protection database.
description.long:
Starts up the slashing protection database using built-in bash scripts.
It runs the db on docker, listening to localhost:5432, and it applies the db migrations.

--db-password.description:
The password value for the db.
Although the database listens only on localhost, it is recommended to change the default password for added security.

description.short: Skips authorization prompt before executing bash scripts.
description.long:
When this flag is passed, the tool will not prompt for confirmation before executing bash scripts.
Only pass this flag if you trust the code that will get executed.
